items.text: pitched up on off stump, pushed to mid-off off the front foot
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: shortish and outside off, punched on the up to cover
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: Danushka, you beauty! He throws the stumps down from backward point at the striker's end but catch Shakib short. Huuuuuge wicket for Sri Lanka. This was even shorter and outside off, punched into the cover-point region. Danushka tears across to his left, swoops down on the ball and nails the stumps.Tamim called for the single, there was a brief hesitation between the wickets, and Shakib gave up in the end. Danushka is one of the best fielders in the SL side. Can't take him on

dismissal.text: Shakib Al Hasan run out (Gunathilaka) 8 (8b 2x4 0x6) SR: 100.00

items.text: full and outside off, tapped into the covers

Another stunning piece of fielding from Danushka. His brilliance in the field has sent back both Shakib and Tamim. He throws himself to his right from backward point now, stretches out with both hands, and snaffles a catch. Credit to Lakmal too for banging it short just a shade outside off, surprising the batsman and forcing him to splice a catch. It actually reared up from a back of a length

dismissal.text: Tamim Iqbal c Gunathilaka b Lakmal 5 (14b 0x4 0x6) SR: 35.71

items.text: Lakmal runs in hard, hits the deck harder, but this bouncer sails over the batsman and the leaping keeper. The ball rolls away to the boundary
good length on off stump, defended back off the front foot
Chameera ventures wide of the crease and angles a full ball in on middle at 141ks, bunted to mid-on
items.shortText: Chameera to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Kasun Suraj: "Am I on a dream???? Lakmal & Dhanushka you beauty. This is the start that we all were looking for. Fantastic."
items.text: back of a length and angling in at off, 143.6ks, run away to backward point off the face

items.preText: Both Shakib and Tamim - who were the architects of three bonus-point wins - are out cheaply. Mashrafe wanted more from the middle order. Now is the chance to step up
items.text: short on off, Mahmudullah fends it off to the off side

items.preText: Ashek Mahmood: "Big test coming for Sabbir and Nasir"
items.text: pitched up and outside off, driven through the line to extra cover
items.postText: Lenin: "This is a test for BD to show how much they have actually improved by building a few long-lasting partnerships and posting a solid total "

items.preText: Sadman Hasan: "On a positive note, this is a chance for Bangladesh middle order batsman to stand up and go through a proper trial before the Final."
items.text: bouncer on off stump, 136.2ks, ducks under it hurriedly
back of a length and outside off, dabs with soft hands to deep third man

items.preText: Ammar Jahfar: "Wow Danuksha you legend! Watching this on TV is so satisfying for Sri Lankan fans. The continuous replays of Danuksha's brilliance. Mind you pressure building up on Mahmadullah and Mushfiqur!"
items.text: back of a length and angling in on middle and leg, cramps the batsman for room, defended to mid-on

items.preText: Chandana: "Haven' t seen a run out from SL for while before this...that tells about their fielding in recent past...
items.text: good length and angling into a forward-defensive push back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, Mahmudullah punches away from the body and ends up squeezing an inside edge back down the pitch
just short of a good length and outside off, punched up to backward point. Crisply hit but straight to the fielder
full and angling in at off stump, sort of stops on the batsman, checks his push and plays it to the covers
items.postText: Dharshan: "It now becomes Chandi's duty to get more wickets! SL tend to rest and lose the advantage gained!"

items.text: another checked drive into the covers to round out the over
items.postText: SarfBD: "I am kind of happy. This match is dead rubber for Bangladesh, and the middle order isn't really tested. Last match was kind of warning sign. Lets see how the middle order responds. If they fail, it should be a much needed reality check. If they pass, we can be truly satisfied."

items.text: wide of the crease, short and angling in, fended to cover
items.shortText: Chameera to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: back of a length on off, opens the face and pats it to backward point
items.shortText: Chameera to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: 138.1ks bouncer, outside off, flies through to the keeper as the batsman ducks. Too high, and called a wide
items.postText: Raju: "Today is a good opportunity for other Players rather than Shakib and Tamim to prove their worth in Bangladesh National Team.."

items.text: full and outside off, Mushfiq tucks his bat away from the line and lets it go
items.shortText: Chameera to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: back of a length and angling into middle, the batsman shuffles across and turns the ball to square leg
items.shortText: Chameera to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: dug short and outside off, Mushfiq jumps off the ground and inside-edges it to the covers
items.shortText: Chameera to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run
